column4: *lol* I went into Sound Preference, next to Sound playback: it says "Autodetect" I hit the "Test" button and the Sound Preference panel crashed!
sounds like problem
what kind of sound chipset?
Errr, CMEDIA I think(?) -- ASUS board, NVIDIA chipset
did you check forums? the come in handy for specific hardware issues
OK, I made progress. I switched one of the options to "USB Audio" and it blasted my ears with a loud tone
you have usb audio?
I don't think I do, but it was the only option that blasted me with a loud tone.
does alsa load fine?
how do i check? :P I am copying an MP3 off my iPod right now and gonna try to play it
i would say restart the alsa daemon
ok, double check everything is hooked up right, (humor me, check the plugs and all)
A loud tone came out, so I assume that it is plugged in OK, and yes I checked the plugs again.
ok, loud tones can come from power cables too, so u never know
u did put it back to auto detect right?
No, I left it on USB Audio
I just need to find a sound now to test if real sound comes out or not :P
you should have heard sounds @ startup unless you changed it
go to command line
I have no idea why, but USB Audio worked, I put Beastie Boys - License to Ill in and I'm getting sound now.
Strangely, in the volume control panel none of the volume sliders work except for the "Speaker 1" sliders.
